SHR StageTimingPrefixCS CodeSystem

When staging was done, relative to treatment events.

name: StageTimingPrefixCS
title: SHR StageTimingPrefixCS CodeSystem
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: When staging was done, relative to treatment events.

concept.display: Staging performed prior to surgery, based on evidence such as physical examination, imaging, and/or biopsy.
concept.definition: Staging performed prior to surgery, based on evidence such as physical examination, imaging, and/or biopsy.

concept.display: Staging performed based on examination of tissue samples removed during surgery, in addition to physical examination and imaging.
concept.definition: Staging performed based on examination of tissue samples removed during surgery, in addition to physical examination and imaging.

concept.display: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) clinical staging based on clinical examination after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation, when no surgery has been performed.
concept.definition: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) clinical staging based on clinical examination after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation, when no surgery has been performed.

concept.display: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) pathologic staging, based  on tissue samples removed during surgery after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation.
concept.definition: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) pathologic staging, based  on tissue samples removed during surgery after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation.
